perturbation.original_text: 21. GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the state of Florida. If litigation results from or arises out of this Agreement or the performance thereof, each Party shall be responsible for its own attorneys' fees, court costs, and all other expenses, whether or not taxable by the court as costs.
perturbation.changed_text: 25. HEADINGS. Headings used in this Agreement are provided for convenience only and shall not be used to construe meaning or intent. 21. GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the state of Florida. If litigation results from or arises out of this Agreement or the performance thereof, each Party may or may not be responsible for its own attorneys' fees, court costs, and all other expenses, whether or not taxable by the court as costs, depending on the specific case.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states each party is responsible for their own legal fees. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by stating that this responsibility 'may or may not' exist, contradicting the original clarity and making it difficult to enforce. By moving the governing law clause to after the headings, it is slightly less visible.

perturbation.original_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur. 3. By either Party for a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party, if the other Party's material breach is not cured within three (3) days of receipt of written notice thereof. This shall include any delays to the timeline specified in Exhibit A. 4. By the Client at any time and without prior notice, if the Developer is convicted of any crime or offense, fails or refuses to comply with the written policies or reasonable directives of the Client, or is guilty of serious misconduct in connection with performance under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. TERMINATION. (a) Types of Termination. This Agreement may be terminated: 1. By either Party on provision of seven (7) days written notice to the other Party in case of a Force Majeure Event. 2. Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment if agreed by both parties. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur, if client deems it neccessary. 3. By either Party for a material breach of any provision of this Agreement by the other Party, if the other Party's material breach is not cured within three (3) days of receipt of written notice thereof. This shall include any delays to the timeline specified in Exhibit A, this may not include client changes to the timeline. 4. By the Client at any time and without prior notice, if the Developer is convicted of any crime or offense, fails or refuses to comply with the written policies or reasonable directives of the Client, or is guilty of serious misconduct in connection with performance under this Agreement, this may be subject to review.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states the conditions for termination. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by stating conditions that now must be agreed by both parties, contradicting the original clarity and making it difficult to enforce. By adding 'this may not include client changes to the timeline' and 'this may be subject to review' it gives the power to the client to not hold the developer accountable.

perturbation.original_text: 24. ENTIRE AGREEMENT. This Agreement constitutes the final, complete, and exclusive statement of the agreement of the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any and all other prior and contemporaneous agreements and understandings, both written and oral, between the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 24. ENTIRE AGREEMENT. This Agreement constitutes the final statement of the agreement of the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, however this may be subject to external agreements and understandings, both written and oral, between the Parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly states the agreement is final, complete and exclusive. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by stating that this statement may be subject to external agreements and understandings, contradicting the original clarity and making it difficult to enforce.
